roleset.name: view

example.name: NP and attribute as PP
example.text: John saw the President as a fool.

roleset.note: The fundamental difference between the embedded S and the NP-with-attribute is that in the embedded S the embedded verb is marked for tense (it isn't in the NP-with-attribute), and the embedded subject will not show accusative case: "John saw him collapse" vs "John saw the he collapsed".

roleset.name: verb of motion: accompany

example.name: a polite young man
example.text: John saw the President to his car.

roleset.note: Arg2 could also be "out" or some other non-PP.

roleset.name: discourse function

example.name: you see
example.text: After Mary killed John, you see, she had to win the Nobel Prize.

roleset.note: I don't know if this even occurs.

example.name: see to it
example.text: They should see to it that their kids don't play truant; they should make certain that the children spend enough time doing homework; they should scrutinize the report card.
example.arg: that their kids don't play truant
